name: SGA - Student Senate
description:
The Texas A&M University Student Senate represents all students in order to enhance the Texas A&M experience within our university and communities through research, legislation, and advocacy in accordance with the core values of our institution.

Founded in 1947, the Student Senate is the representative voice of the student body. Functioning as the legislative branch of Student Government, the Senate works to identify and advocate student opinion on issues affecting the Aggie Experience to faculty, administration, governmental bodies, and other student organizations. It is comprised of 80 Student Senators, Nine Officers, and is always open to any student to voice their concerns.

 

To find what senators represent your caucus as well as current attendance for those senators, please click here.
summary: The Texas A&M University Student Senate represents all students in order to enhance the Texas A&M experience within our university and communities through research, legislation, and advocacy in accordance with the core values of our institution.
